message: Starting review of race condition fixes in orchestrator MCP. Will examine real_mcp_server.py and verify all registry operations use proper locking.
Found critical issue: update_agent_progress at line 2277 uses plain open() instead of LockedRegistryFile. This is a race condition vulnerability. Checking report_agent_finding next.
Found 9 instances of unlocked registry access! Analyzing each to determine severity and which functions are affected.
Checking deploy_headless_agent and other functions for registry write operations after unlocked reads. Need to identify all race-prone functions.
Verified get_real_task_status is PROPERLY FIXED with LockedRegistryFile. Now checking other functions and waiting for peer agent's fixes to update_agent_progress.
Deploy_headless_agent still has unfixed race condition. Waiting for peer to fix or will report it as missed. Checking for any other unlocked registry operations.
Waiting for peer to address deploy_headless_agent race condition. If not fixed soon, will report as critical missed issue. Verified kill_real_agent properly uses locking functions.
Checking for peer updates on deploy_headless_agent fix. Will complete review soon.
Code review complete. Verified 2 functions fixed, 2 safe, 1 CRITICAL unfixed (deploy_headless_agent). Also found 8 other potential unlocked registry reads that may need review.
